image.altText: Photo of King Charles looking serious

props.synopsis: The King had been treated in hospital last month for a benign prostate condition, but during the stay in hospital, the palace said "a separate issue of concern was noted". The 75-year-old has begun treatment and will stand down from public-facing duties while that continues.

title.children: King Charles III has cancer, has commenced treatment, palace reveals

image.altText: A photo of a Chinese-Australian man Yang Hengjun, sitting on an outside table, wearing a navy polo shirt with a red collar.

props.synopsis: The writer and democracy activist has been imprisoned since 2019 on charges of spying, which he denies. Foreign Minister Penny Wong called the court's decision "harrowing and appalling", although his death penalty can be converted to a life sentence after two years of good behaviour.

title.children: Chinese ambassador to explain 'appalling' death sentence for Australian Yang Hengjun

image.altText: A portrait of Malcolm Turnbull looking determinedly down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: The ABC's political docuseries Nemesis is back. We unpack the biggest moments from episode 2, with political analysis from Annabel Crabb.

title.children: We relived the thrills and spills of the Turnbull years in Nemesis — with political analysis from Annabel Crabb

image.altText: Artist impression of retirement village being built trackside in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: St Hilliers is placed into voluntary administration as work halts on its developments around Australia, including major projects in Newcastle, the Central Coast and Brisbane.

title.children: Construction giant calls in administrators leaving 21 multimillion-dollar developments dangling

image.altText: a man hugs a young boy in front of a pile of floral tributes

props.synopsis: Five teenagers have been arrested as police continue to investigate the stabbing death of a 70-year-old grandmother at an Ipswich shopping centre.

title.children: Five teenagers in police custody as investigation into stabbing death of grandmother continues

image.altText: The silhouette of a child sitting on a bed with an adult sitting alongside them.

props.synopsis: State care failings are being investigated following a 12-year-old girl being charged with murder. 125 reports alleging abuse in the care system have been made to the commissioner of children and young people in the past nine months.

title.children: 'Significant concerns': Inquiry launched into state care of 12-year-old accused of murder

image.altText: Cliffs meet the waters edge in an arid setting

props.synopsis: Wreckage of the four-wheel-drive, which was driven off a steep cliff at a remote beach in the early hours of Sunday morning, will be closely examined by police.

title.children: 'Everybody is feeling it': 4WD plunges off steep cliff claiming two young lives

image.altText: A person in a red jacket is knee-deep in flood waters walking towards a car.

props.synopsis: The National Weather Service is warning the storm could bring heavy rain, snow and coastal flooding to the golden state.

title.children: Nearly 700,000 without power, parts of southern California in state of emergency as storm escalates

image.altText: Young men and women cover their faces as tear gas spreads through a crowd of people and cars.

props.synopsis: President Macky Sall's unprecedented announcement on Saturday that he would move to delay the Senegal's election pitched the West African nation into uncharted constitutional waters.

title.children: Senegalese government tear-gasses protesters, cuts off internet ahead of vote to delay election

image.altText: A livestock vessel docked off the coast

props.synopsis: About 16,000 livestock will stay stranded on a ship in Perth after the federal agriculture department forbid them from being re-exported.

title.children: Agriculture department forbids 16,000 livestock stranded in Perth being re-exported to Israel

image.altText: Russell Vale mine Wollongong

props.synopsis: The troubled Russell Vale Colliery, located in the northern Illawarra region of New South Wales, has notified its workforce of its impending closure.

title.children: Coal mine to close in Wollongong, impacting more than 100 workers

image.altText: Taylor Swift wearing a white strapless dress with a thigh slip and a train and black long gloves

props.synopsis: Pop star Taylor Swift announces her new album, The Tortured Poets Department, while collecting her 13th Grammy before winning album of the year. This and other Grammy moments.

title.children: Grammys best moments include Taylor Swift revealing two-year-old secret — a new album

image.altText: A composite of Miley Cyrus, Kylie Minogue, Taylor Swift and Ice Spice at the Grammys.

props.synopsis: It's an awards night for the music industry but there's always plenty of drama and theatrics on the Grammys red carpet.

title.children: What they wore: The good, bad and the ugly from the Grammys red carpet

image.altText: A split image showing a smiling, blonde woman in a formal dress. She is also shown near a car in a driveway.

props.synopsis: Police and SES personnel are searching an area of state forest near the Victorian city in search of the missing 51-year-old.

title.children: Concerns grow for Ballarat woman last seen leaving for morning run

image.altText: The outside of the McDonald's restaurant in Broome, WA

props.synopsis: A man found guilty of encouraging girls as young as seven to engage in sexual behaviour at a Broome McDonald's is granted bail so a psychological assessment can take place before his sentencing.

title.children: Man granted bail despite being found guilty of trying to lure children into McDonald's toilet

image.altText: Tasmania Police scene tape, generic image.

props.synopsis: A young Tasmanian man who accused his then-girlfriend of cheating on him, then subjected her to 48 hours of horrific abuse, is sentenced to a decade in prison.

title.children: Woman's horrific ordeal at hands of 20yo man detailed as he is sentenced to a decade in prison

image.altText: an outside shot of the beach road hotel in bondi

props.synopsis: On Monday, a Sydney court was told the complainant travelled interstate after the alleged assault in a Bondi hotel cubicle to visit her fiance's family and shop for a wedding dress.

title.children: Woman told fiance's mother Kurtley Beale 'could hardly stand up', 'won't remember' alleged sexual assault, court told

image.altText: A man wearing a crumpled blue shirt looks down.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Visser first contacted the girl on the social media app Snapchat, then told an internal school investigation the friend request was a mistake he made after a night of drinking.

title.children: WA school teacher jailed for sexual abuse of teenage student after messaging on Snapchat

image.altText: A huge storm looms over a mining town.

props.synopsis: Towns in SA, NSW and Queensland continue to feel the effects of the cyclone, which is bringing rain and wind to isolated areas.

title.children: Storms rage through outback towns as Kirrily aftermath continues

image.altText: Nick Ham before and after weight-loss surgery.

props.synopsis: Nick Ham lost about half his body weight after spending more than $20,000 on bariatric surgery -- much of it paid for by his dad, who withdrew from his superannuation on compassionate grounds.

title.children: You can't put a price on health – but in Nick's case, it was almost $23,000

image.altText: People including a man using a wheelchair near a makeshift tent

props.synopsis: A housing summit addressing intergenerational equity has been held in Sydney, as a report found less than half of the children born in the city today will ever own a home.

title.children: San Francisco 'wiped out' the middle class. Sydney needs to 'act now' to ensure housing equity, NSW treasurer says

image.altText: A man with glasses wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The Seoul Central District Court said the prosecution failed to provide enough evidence that the 2015 merger was unlawfully conducted.

title.children: South Korean court acquits Samsung chief Lee Jae-yong of financial crimes

image.altText: A close up of the front of a Boeing 737 MAX plane in the air, with its front wheels down

props.synopsis: The plane maker's CEO tells staff the company "will have to perform rework on about 50 undelivered planes".

title.children: Boeing reports holes not drilled correctly on some new 737 jets, possibly delaying delivery

image.altText: car exhaust

props.synopsis: The federal government has detailed its proposal to impose a CO2 standard on new cars. It will have a narrow road to travel to ensure it cuts emissions without driving up car prices.

title.children: Will the government's fuel efficiency standard drive up car prices? It depends what road it goes down

image.altText: An Indian bowler dances and pumps his fists mid-pitch as an England batter walks back to the pavilion.

props.synopsis: England falls short of the target in Visakhapatnam, as India delights home fans with a series-levelling Test win.

title.children: India levels England Test series with victory in Visakhapatnam

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two Victorian men will face court after 139 kilograms of cocaine were found allegedly hidden inside luxury buses in an international shipment that arrived in Adelaide via Perth, with border force officials saying cocaine shipments are being seized at "unprecedented levels".

title.children: Cocaine allegedly hidden in luxury buses seized by police and border force officials

image.altText: Composite of Bridgerton's Luke Newton & Nicola Coughlan with Ayo Edebiri & Jessica Mauboy against a hazy blue-green background.

props.synopsis: All the entertainment and pop culture news you might've missed, from Daft Punk's potential return to True Detective drama and more.

title.children: ICYMI: Bridgerton is back, Ayo Edebiri slays SNL, Sophie-Ellis Bextor announces Aus tour, plus loads more

image.altText: A staircase leading down to the beach and waves crashing into the shore.

props.synopsis: The distraught family of a young man missing off Victoria's Mornington Peninsula urge the community to be careful, after the outgoing rugby player was swept away in a rip on Sunday.

title.children: Family in shock after 'outgoing' young rugby player swept from Victorian beach

image.altText: A white silky bantam chicken.

props.synopsis: A man has pleaded not guilty to allegedly removing a live silky bantam chicken, called Betty White, from a wildlife park enclosure and throwing it into a nearby alligator enclosure.

title.children: Live chicken allegedly thrown to alligators in incident likened to 'David Attenborough documentary'

image.altText: A small baby looks at camera and smiles.

props.synopsis: Daniel John Ridgers pleads not guilty to murdering baby Khaylan Shane Butler at a home on Hobart's eastern shore.

title.children: Family cry as Hobart man pleads not guilty to murdering 10-month-old Khaylan Butler

image.altText: A close-up selfie of a woman on a horse in a cowboy hat and a man holding a large digital camera.

props.synopsis: Barrel racer Megan McLoughlin surrounds herself with storytellers who understand her challenges to bring her story to life — and friends with bells and whistles to help her safely navigate the rodeo arena.

title.children: Legally blind rodeo racer challenges views on disability with innovative storytelling
